item.title: Visual Studio Devs Share Copilot AI Prompts to Improve Code
item.description: Microsoft's Mads Kristensen took to social media to ask Visual Studio developers to share their favorite prompts to get GitHub Copilot AI to improve their code.

item.title: Azure AI Foundry Gets 'Computer-Using Agent' for Autonomous GUI Interaction
item.description: Microsoft is expanding functionality for agentic AI into its Azure AI Foundry platform, furthering one of the hottest areas of development right now where AI controls computers just like humans.

item.title: Microsoft Previews GPT-4o Copilot Code Completion and .NET AI Template in Visual Studio
item.description: Things are happening quickly in the Microsoft-centric AI dev space, with the company previewing new AI features in Visual Studio 2022 ranging from a new .NET AI template to GPT-4o Copilot Code Completion.

item.title: Microsoft Ports TypeScript to Go for 10x Native Performance Gains
item.description: Microsoft is revamping its TypeScript programming language with a native compiler and toolset. This effort seeks to address performance challenges, especially in large codebases, by porting the existing TypeScript compiler from TypeScript/JavaScript to the native language, Go.

item.title: Uno Platform Takes 'Hot Design' for Cross-Platform .NET Apps to Public Beta
item.description: Uno Platform has taken its "Hot Design" feature to public beta, extending the "Hot Reload" paradigm with functionality to visually edit and refine a running app in real-time.

item.title: New VS Code Release Polishes Experimental GitHub Copilot Agent Mode
item.description: Continuing the journey from "AI pair programmer" to "autonomous peer programmer" to, eventually, just "AI programmer," no human coding needed, just supervision.

item.title: Semantic Kernel Agent Framework Graduates to Release Candidate
item.description: With agentic AI now firmly established as a key component of modern software development, Microsoft graduated its Semantic Kernel Agent Framework to Release Candidate 1 status.

item.title: TypeScript 5.8 Improves Type Checking, Conditional Feature Delayed to 5.9
item.description: Microsoft shipped TypeScript 5.8 with improved type checking in some scenarios, but thorny problems caused the dev team to delay related work to the next release.

item.title: Cloud-Focused .NET Aspire 9.1 Released
item.description: Along with .NET 10 Preview 1, Microsoft released.NET Aspire 9.1, the latest update to its opinionated, cloud-ready stack for building resilient, observable, and configurable cloud-native applications with .NET.

item.title: Microsoft Ships First .NET 10 Preview
item.description: Microsoft shipped .NET 10 Preview 1, introducing a raft of improvements and fixes across performance, libraries, and the developer experience.

item.title: C# Dev Kit Previews .NET Aspire Orchestration
item.description: Microsoft's dev team has been busy updating the C# Dev Kit, a Visual Studio Code extension that enhances the C# development experience by providing tools for managing, debugging, and editing C# projects.

item.title: VS Code Copilot Previews New GPT-4o AI Code Completion Model
item.description: The 4o upgrade includes additional training on more than 275,000 high-quality public repositories in over 30 popular programming languages, said Microsoft-owned GitHub, which created the original "AI pair programmer" years ago.

item.title: Microsoft's Rust Embrace Continues with Azure SDK Beta
item.description: "Rust's strong type system and ownership model help prevent common programming errors such as null pointer dereferencing and buffer overflows, leading to more secure and stable code."

item.title: Xcode IDE from Microsoft Archrival Apple Gets Copilot AI
item.description: Just after expanding the reach of its Copilot AI coding assistant to the open-source Eclipse IDE, Microsoft showcased how it's going even further, providing details about a preview version for the Xcode IDE from archrival Apple.

item.title: Microsoft Previews Copilot AI for Open-Source Eclipse IDE
item.description: Catering to Java jockeys, Microsoft is yet again expanding the sprawling reach of its Copilot-branded AI assistants, previewing a coding tool for the open-source Eclipse IDE.

item.title: Visual Studio 2022 v17.13 Ships: 'Meet GitHub Copilot Free'
item.description: New GitHub Copilot AI features range from AI-enhanced feature search to edits across files, new shortcuts and expansion of slash commands, along with much more.

item.title: VS Code Copilot Gets Closer to Tab, Tab, Tab Coding
item.description: Microsoft is previewing new AI tech that predicts next edits, allowing devs to just Tab to accept them and keep on going.

item.title: GitHub Previews Agentic AI in VS Code Copilot
item.description: GitHub announced a raft of improvements to its Copilot AI in the Visual Studio Code editor, including a new "agent mode" in preview that lets developers use the AI technology to write code faster and more accurately.

item.title: Uno Platform Wants Microsoft to Improve .NET WebAssembly in Two Ways
item.description: Uno Platform, a third-party dev tooling specialist that caters to .NET developers, published a report on the state of WebAssembly, addressing some shortcomings in the .NET implementation it would like to see Microsoft address.

item.title: As Some Orgs Restrict DeepSeek AI Usage, Microsoft Offers Models and Dev Guidance
item.description: While some organizations are restricting employee usage of the new open source DeepSeek AI from a Chinese company due to data collection concerns, Microsoft has taken a different approach.

item.title: TypeScript 5.8 Beta Speeds Program Loads, Updates
item.description: "TypeScript 5.8 introduces a number of optimizations that can both improve the time to build up a program, and also to update a program based on a file change in either --watch mode or editor scenarios."

item.title: AI Toolkit for VS Code Now Lets You 'Bring Your Own Model'
item.description: "AI Toolkit extension for VS code now supports external local models via Ollama. It has also added support remote hosted models using API keys for OpenAI, Google and Anthropic."

item.title: Visual Studio Copilot Improves Feature Search, Shortcuts, Slash Commands
item.description: Microsoft's Visual Studio dev team has been working on the next release of its flagship IDE, Visual Studio 2022 v17.13, with an emphasis on improving the GitHub Copilot AI-powered coding assistant.

item.title: AI-Powered Trae IDE Ships from Chinese TikTok Owner: 'It Looks To Be a Fork'
item.description: As Chinese AI tech shakes up the entire industry with new breakthroughs, a new AI-powered IDE from a Beijing firm is flying under the radar, based on the same tech that powers Visual Studio Code and many other code editors.

item.title: Microsoft Duels JetBrains with Same-Day AI Coding Moves
item.description: In an IDE AI update, this week we see JetBrains introducing a new coding agent called Junie just as Microsoft unveiled a free tier for GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio.

item.title: Microsoft Revamps Fledgling AutoGen Framework for Agentic AI
item.description: Only at v0.4, Microsoft's AutoGen framework for agentic AI -- the hottest new trend in AI development -- has already undergone a complete revamp, going to an asynchronous, event-driven architecture.

item.title: IDE Irony: Coding Errors Cause 'Critical' Vulnerability in Visual Studio
item.description: In a larger-than-normal Patch Tuesday, Microsoft warned of a "critical" vulnerability in Visual Studio that should be fixed immediately if automatic patching isn't enabled, ironically caused by coding errors.

item.title: Microsoft Execs to Tackle AI and Cloud in Dev Conference Keynotes
item.description: AI unsurprisingly is all over keynotes that Microsoft execs will helm to kick off the Visual Studio Live! developer conference in Las Vegas, March 10-14, which the company described as "a must-attend event."

item.title: Copilot Agentic AI Dev Environment Opens Up to All
item.description: Microsoft removed waitlist restrictions for some of its most advanced GenAI tech, Copilot Workspace, recently made available as a technical preview.

item.title: Microsoft's New Cloudy Java: The Modern Web App Pattern and 'Strangler Fig'
item.description: Having introduced its Modern Web Application (MWA) pattern for Java developers late last year, Microsoft is now promoting the cloud-centric concept further by highlighting the benefits of the "Strangler Fig" approach.

item.title: VS Code Python Devs Get 'Full' Language Server Mode for Pylance
item.description: Serving tens of millions of developers, Microsoft's dev team for Python in Visual Studio Code shipped a new release with three major new features, including a "full" language server mode for Pylance, which provides language-specific "smarts," including IntelliSense.

item.title: Top 10 GitHub Copilot Extensions, Led by Docker and PerplexityAI
item.description: They work in GitHub.com, the Visual Studio IDE and VS Code, where developers can access various services, perform actions and generate files without leaving those dev environments.

item.title: Compare New GitHub Copilot Free Plan for Visual Studio/VS Code to Paid Plans
item.description: The free plan restricts the number of completions, chat requests and access to AI models, being suitable for occasional users and small projects.

item.title: Copilot AI Boosts Abound in New VS Code v1.96
item.description: Microsoft improved on its new "Copilot Edit" functionality in the latest release of Visual Studio Code, v1.96, its open-source based code editor that has become the most popular in the world according to many surveys.

item.title: TypeScript Tops New JetBrains 'Language Promise Index'
item.description: In its latest annual developer ecosystem report, JetBrains introduced a new "Language Promise Index" topped by Microsoft's TypeScript programming language.

item.title: OpenSilver 3.1 Unveils Drag-and-Drop XAML Designer for VS Code
item.description: Claiming an industry first, Userware announced a drag-and-drop XAML designer for use in VS Code, coming with OpenSilver 3.1, the latest iteration of the open-source implementation of Microsoft's long-deprecated and oft-mourned rich client development platform, Silverlight.

item.title: Visual Studio Dev Vexed by Copilot's Obtuse 'Responsible AI' Refusal
item.description: No matter what, some systems simply won't divulge exactly what in the current conversation caused them to balk, simply pointing to vague policies and generic guidance.

item.title: On Blazor Component Reusability - From Day 0
item.description: "We want to try to design from Day One, even Day Zero, with reusability in mind," says Blazor expert Allen Conway in imparting his expertise to an audience of hundreds in an online tech event on Tuesday.

item.title: Visual Studio's AI Future: Copilot .NET Upgrades and More
item.description: At this week's Microsoft Ignite conference, the Visual Studio team showed off a future AI-powered IDE that will leverage GitHub Copilot for legacy app .NET upgrades, along with several more cutting-edge features.

item.title: PowerShell Gets AI-ified in 'AI Shell' Preview
item.description: Eschewing the term "Copilot," Microsoft introduced a new AI-powered tool for PowerShell called "AI Shell," available in preview.

item.title: GitHub Research Claims Copilot Code Quality Gains in Addition to Productivity
item.description: GitHub says new research proves its Copilot AI tool can improve code quality, following earlier reports that said it boosts developer productivity -- and has a retort for contrarian studies.

item.title: Visual Studio Devs Demand Claude 3.5 Sonnet AI: 'Why Is VSC Always Preferred?'
item.description: The brand-new Visual Studio 2022 v17.12 lets devs specify the AI model they want to use with the baked-in GitHub Copilot, but some are clamoring for more options, such as the latest/greatest Claude 3.5 Sonnet model from Anthropic that is available in VS Code.

item.title: SQL Database in Microsoft Fabric in Preview for Faster AI Apps
item.description: Microsoft's early embrace of advanced AI in its dev tooling continues apace with the new public preview of SQL database in Microsoft Fabric, the company's analytics/data platform.

item.title: Microsoft Seeks to Sort & Simplify its Agentic AI Dev Story
item.description: The company will infuse multi-agent runtime tech developed in its AutoGen research project into its production-ready Semantic Kernel SDK, both open source.

item.title: Uno Platform Unveils 'Hot Design' Tool for Cross-Platform .NET Apps
item.description: Uno Platform provided a new take on visual designers for .NET app development, claiming a breakthrough that changes code at runtime rather than the design stage.

item.title: Visual Studio 2022 v17.12 Ships with AI Enhancements and Streamlined Dev Tools
item.description: Microsoft just shipped Visual Studio 2022 v17.12, focusing on enhancing developer experiences specifically for .NET 9 projects and introducing new AI productivity features. This update incorporates numerous developer-requested enhancements aimed at simplifying workflows and improving overall productivity.

item.title: In .NET 9 Debut, Microsoft Focuses on .NET Aspire, AI
item.description: Microsoft shipped .NET 9 today with the dev team highlighting .NET Aspire and AI in a keynote and follow-on sessions of the livestreamed launch event.

item.title: Microsoft Intros 'Guided Chat Experience' for GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio
item.description: Microsoft introduced a new guided chat experience within GitHub Copilot, aiming to make developer interactions with AI more natural and effective.

item.title: Microsoft's Open-Source Semantic Kernel AI Toolkit Extends to AWS Cloud
item.description: Microsoft announced its open-source Semantic Kernel toolkit for integrating advanced AI models into applications is now available on the Amazon Bedrock managed service.

item.title: Microsoft Previews Copilot AI in SQL Server Management Studio
item.description: In announcing SSMS 21 Preview 1 this week, Microsoft revealed Copilot AI for the tool is also being previewed, privately.

item.title: Blitz of New VS Code AI Improvements Include 'Copilot Edits'
item.description: Microsoft's October 2024 release of Visual Studio Code (v1.95) focuses on enhancing the AI-driven development experience through GitHub Copilot. AI-related updates affect large code edits, multi-account support, and a more accessible Copilot Chat.

item.title: Microsoft Previews Mads Kristensen Keynote at Orlando Dev Conference
item.description: Microsoft today previewed a keynote presentation by Visual Studio guru Mads Kristensen at an upcoming developer/IT pro event where he will be joined by other company dev luminaries such as Jon Galloway, Rachel Kang, and James Montemagno.

item.title: Syncfusion Open Sources 14 Controls for .NET MAUI
item.description: Third-party .NET-centric dev UI tooling specialist Syncfusion this week announced the open sourcing of 14 controls for .NET MAUI, the evolution of Xamarin.Forms that adds support for building desktop apps.

item.title: New Combit Reporting Tool Release Supports .NET 9
item.description: The List & Label reporting tool by combit helps devs integrate advanced reporting, printing and exporting capabilities into their apps for web, cloud and desktop environments with minimal code.

item.title: Copilot AI Enhanced in Flurry of Visual Studio v17.12 Previews
item.description: Since announcing Visual Studio 2022 v17.11 in August, Microsoft's dev team has been busy shipping a series of AI-heavy previews for the next edition.

item.title: How Visual Studio IntelliCode Helped Shape GitHub Copilot and Modern AI
item.description: Microsoft has baked advanced GitHub Copilot tech into the latest edition of Visual Studio, but the aging IntelliCode feature of the IDE actually helped shape the modern experience.

item.title: VS Code Is Latest Microsoft Dev Tooling Weaponized by Threat Actors
item.description: Cybersecurity threat actors keep leveraging Microsoft development tooling as attack vectors, with the new one coming via malware phishing.

item.title: AI Explains Expressions in Update to Java on VS Code
item.description: "The Spring Tools now show code lenses above these expressions that allow you to quickly let GitHub Copilot explain those statements for you."

item.title: Microsoft Eases Integration with Semantic Kernel AI SDK
item.description: The basic idea is to provide unified API abstractions, especially for idiomatic C# code, to help platform developers and others work with any provider with standard implementations for caching, telemetry, tool calling and other common tasks.

item.title: Final .NET 9 Preview Ships with Go-Live License
item.description: Visual Studio developers can now download the SDK for .NET 9 Release Candidate 2 with a go-live license, meaning devs get Microsoft support for production applications even before the framework reaches general availability next month.
